unicamp.title: Why Unicamp?
unicamp.description: We are a team of professionals with extensive experience in international IT companies and education. Our team members have taught on renowned platforms and academies such as Udacity, Coursera, Software Development Academy, buildup.am, CodeAcademy, and FastTrack. Some of the courses developed by our team are still being used by CodeAcademy and FastTrack. By closely following market trends and analyzing your needs, we are ready to offer top-quality courses that will help you explore and master the IT landscape.

questions.question: What are the funding options?
questions.answer:
The kursuok.lt platform offers funding up to 500 EUR for employed individuals (under an employment contract, self-employed, or with a business license).

 However, Kursuok is currently undergoing an audit, and funding has been paused. Kursuok funding will be renewed in the fall of 2025 (https://kursuok.lt/naujienos/paaiskejo-kada-bus-papildytas-kursuok-biudzetas).

If you would like to receive funding, please fill out the application, and we will contact you as soon as funding is renewed.

questions.question: How are the courses conducted?
questions.answer: The courses are held remotely via Zoom with the course instructor. There are also practical sessions where you will work on real projects.

questions.question: How long do the courses last?
questions.answer: The courses last about 12 weeks, totaling 108 academic hours.

questions.question: What is the course schedule?
questions.answer: Courses take place 2–3 times a week, depending on the program. Typically, courses are held on Wednesdays from 18:30 to 21:30 and Saturdays from 9:00 to 12:00, or Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays from 18:30 to 21:30.

questions.question: What are my obligations when joining the courses?
questions.answer: Engage, strive, and actively participate in the classes.

questions.question: I am a beginner in IT. Can I join the courses?
questions.answer: Absolutely! Our courses do not require specific IT knowledge and are designed for beginners. All you need is basic computer literacy and some knowledge of English.

questions.question: How much time should I dedicate to the courses?
questions.answer: The time required depends on the program and your pace. Classes are held 2–3 times a week, but the total amount of self-study time will depend on you. The best part? We will always help you, even after the classes.

questions.question: What do the final assessments look like, or is there grading?
questions.answer: In our academy, the final assessment is a project. We do not grade assessments with marks. Students who successfully complete the project receive a pass and successfully finish the course.

questions.question: Will I receive a certificate?
questions.answer: Yes! After completing the course, you will receive a Unicamp certificate.

questions.question: What if I cannot attend some of the lessons?
questions.answer: Don’t worry. All classes are recorded, so you can review them later. If you need additional help, our instructors will assist you.

questions.question: Will I be able to access the learning materials after the course ends?
questions.answer: Yes, after the course ends, you will have access to all the learning materials for another 180 days. This will allow you to review key topics and strengthen your acquired knowledge. Additionally, you will be able to contact the instructors and get answers to your questions.
